definition: abbr. for 非洲[Fei1 zhou1], Africa
to not be/not/wrong/incorrect/non-/un-/in-/to reproach or blame/(colloquial) to insist on/simply must
to commit an offense/to violate the law/excuse me! (formal)/see also 得罪[de2 zui5]
to offend sb/to make a faux pas/a faux pas/see also 得罪[de2 zui4]
to commit an offense/to violate the law/excuse me! (formal)/see also 得罪[de2 zui5]
to offend sb/to make a faux pas/a faux pas/see also 得罪[de2 zui4]
criminal ringleader, main offender (idiom); main culprit/fig. main cause of a disaster
to apologize for an offense/to offer one's apology for a fault

sentences.english: The crime of abusing the power and position is a superinduced crime of Criminal Law.
sentences.chinese: 濫用職權罪是《刑法》新增設的罪名。

sentences.english: How can you possibly charge a 7-year-old child with assault and battery?
sentences.chinese: 怎麼能將一個七歲的孩子判爲襲擊和毆打公職人員罪？

sentences.english: And God says sooner or later you will have to face the consequences of your sin.
sentences.chinese: 神說或早或晚你都要面對罪的後果。

sentences.english: Any judicial officer who abuses his power and commits the crime mentioned in the preceding paragraph shall be given a heavier punishment.
sentences.chinese: 司法工作人員濫用職權，犯前款罪的，從重處罰。
我一直強調說，艾文斯並沒有罪。

sentences.english: Where a crime is committed as mentioned in any Article of this Decision, all his earnings and property illegally obtained shall be confiscated;
sentences.chinese: 犯本決定各條罪的，其違法所得的一切財物予以沒收。

sentences.english: She had been sitting on them for a very long time.
sentences.chinese: 難道長得醜是一種罪嗎？

sentences.english: The crime of bending the law for self-seeding is the judicial staff malfeasance of ceremony punishment…
sentences.chinese: 徇私枉法罪是典型的司法工作人員瀆職犯罪。

sentences.english: If being ugly were a crime, you'd get the electric chair.
sentences.chinese: 如果長得醜是一種罪的話，那你就應該被電刑處死。

sentences.english: Selfishness is the root of all sin.
The characteristics of constituting a kidnapping crime.
sentences.chinese: 綁架罪的犯罪構成特徵。

sentences.english: And Nathan said unto David, The LORD also hath put away thy sin; thou shalt not die.
sentences.chinese: 拿單說，耶和華已經除掉你的罪，你必不至於死。

sentences.english: Er water side edge, the blood was buried in the autumn flowers, not hae atonement.
sentences.chinese: 洱水畔邊，血葬秋花，贖不盡前塵的罪。

sentences.english: Christ expiated the sins and propitiated the divine wrath for all his people.
sentences.chinese: 基督替祂的子民贖了他們的罪，並且挽回了神的忿怒。

sentences.english: This message is often overlooked while people bash other sins that are not as common.
sentences.chinese: 儘管人們往往忽視這個訊息打壞，不像其他罪常見。

sentences.english: In the legislation, the organized robbery crime should be further improved.
sentences.chinese: 在立法上，對聚衆哄搶罪還應作進一步完善。

definition: to pardon/to absolve/to exempt from punishment
